body:
Thanks for the issue, we will take it into consideration! Our team of engineers is busy working on many types of features, please give us time to get back to you.

Feature requests that require more discussion may be closed. Read more about our [feature request process](https://forem.dev/foremteam/internal-rfc-process-and-forem-dev-discussions-3gl4) on forem.dev.

To our amazing contributors: issues labeled `type: bug` are always up for grabs, but for feature requests, please wait until we add a `ready for dev` before starting to work on it.

To claim an issue to work on, please leave a comment. If you've claimed the issue and need help, please ping @forem/oss. The OSS Community Manager or the engineers on OSS rotation will follow up.

For full info on how to contribute, please check out our [contributors guide](https://github.com/forem/forem/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md).

Long shot but maybe the routes get overwritten?

https://github.com/forem/forem/blob/main/config/routes.rb#L250-L252

So, the problem here seems to be this:

* We have a Rake task called `navigation_links:create` which adds all the default navigation links.
* This tasks is called from the `forem:setup` task.
* The `forem:setup` task is called from the `app_initializer:setup` task.
* `app_initializer:setup` is called on every deploy (`release-tasks.sh`) and container build (`scripts/entrypoint.sh`)

That last step means that all navigation links from the default set will reappear since this task is completely unconditional. We either have to find a better way to only run this on initial Forem creation or make it conditional in some way (which might be brittle).

issue.title: Remove hardcoded "Home" link from sidebar navigation

labels.name: internal team only
labels.description: internal tasks only for Forem team members

labels.name: size: actual S
labels.description: took a few days or less than a week to complete

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
Right now the "Home" link in the main navigation is hardcoded so Admins can't customize or remove it.

It's been reported by admins several time that they would like to be able to do something about it. Hence this issue.

The idea is to:
1. Remove [hardcoded Home link](https://github.com/forem/forem/blob/main/app/views/layouts/_main_nav.html.erb#L6-L11).
2. Add it back as a dynamically created link in admin's _Navigation_ section `/admin/customization/navigation_links`, on the 1st position.
3. Make sure freshly setup Forems come with that link being added/prepopulated in _Navigation_.

Even though step 2 might seem weird (i.e. _adding what we've just removed?!_) it is the way to not harm those who still want it while at the same time leaving a door to edit/remove if anyone needs to.

---

**FYI**

- We've recently [done similar thing for "Signup" links](https://github.com/forem/forem/issues/15921).
- Related Slack convos:
    - [#pod-admin-experience thread](https://forem-team.slack.com/archives/C01S4QZUDNC/p1641913128078900).
    - From private channel for @Amy: https://forem-team.slack.com/archives/C02DKQ56GU9/p1641373341126500?thread_ts=1641336411.122200&cid=C02DKQ56GU9

cc'ing @Ridhwana @amywtlin @JennieOcken @nickytonline

body:
@citizen428 following up on convo from another PR.. can we fix this? :D not trying to be pushy or anything, but you're right saying that this is kinda required to improve overall experience we're trying to improve in, for example, #16076.

As I don't really understand the technicalities you mentioned above I'm only wondering if this could be tackled and if this is "expensive" thing to fix? or in another words: is there anything stopping us from fixing this bug?
@ludwiczakpawel It definitely can be fixed. How exactly may need some discussion but nothing major I think.
Thank you @citizen428 for some way finding. I self assigned this to look at tomorrow and lay out a game plan.

## Information Gathering

The `rake` invocation chain:

-   The [navigation_links:create](https://github.com/forem/forem/blob/3253ba2c7a03594a9064abf2aa4c3fba085099f5/lib/tasks/add_navigation_links.rake#L26) task loads several URLs.
-   The [forem:setup](https://github.com/forem/forem/blob/3253ba2c7a03594a9064abf2aa4c3fba085099f5/lib/tasks/forem.rake#L5) task invokes `navigation_links:create`.  At present the only task for `forem:setup` is `navigation_links:create`.

The places we invoke `forem:setup`:

-   The [app_initializer:setup](https://github.com/forem/forem/blob/3253ba2c7a03594a9064abf2aa4c3fba085099f5/lib/tasks/app_initializer.rake#L3) task invokes `forem:setup`.
-   The [bin/setup](https://github.com/forem/forem/blob/3253ba2c7a03594a9064abf2aa4c3fba085099f5/bin/setup#L38) script explicitly invokes `app_initializer:setup` (which invokes `forem:setup`) and then explicitly invokes `forem:setup`.

The places we invoke `app_initializer:setup`:

-   The aforementioned [bin/setup](https://github.com/forem/forem/blob/3253ba2c7a03594a9064abf2aa4c3fba085099f5/bin/setup#L38) script.
-   The [scripts/entrypoint.sh](https://github.com/forem/forem/blob/3253ba2c7a03594a9064abf2aa4c3fba085099f5/scripts/entrypoint.sh#L42) script.
-   The [forem/release-tasks.sh](https://github.com/forem/forem/blob/3253ba2c7a03594a9064abf2aa4c3fba085099f5/release-tasks.sh#L18) script.

Callers/references to `bin/setup`:

-   [gitpod-init.sh](https://github.com/forem/forem/blob/3253ba2c7a03594a9064abf2aa4c3fba085099f5/gitpod-init.sh#L8)
-   [forem-docs:docs/getting-started/start-app.md](https://github.com/forem/forem-docs/blob/4c5b78ff2d58620735f4fc720bdf4741926ffd7b/docs/getting-started/start-app.md)
-   [forem-docs:docs/getting-started/installation/linux.md](https://github.com/forem/forem-docs/blob/4c5b78ff2d58620735f4fc720bdf4741926ffd7b/docs/getting-started/installation/linux.md)
-   [forem-docs:docs/getting-started/installation/windows.md](https://github.com/forem/forem-docs/blob/4c5b78ff2d58620735f4fc720bdf4741926ffd7b/docs/getting-started/installation/windows.md)
-   [forem-docs:docs/getting-started/workflow.md](https://github.com/forem/forem-docs/blob/4c5b78ff2d58620735f4fc720bdf4741926ffd7b/docs/getting-started/workflow.md)
-   [forem-docs:docs/getting-started/installation/mac.md](https://github.com/forem/forem-docs/blob/4c5b78ff2d58620735f4fc720bdf4741926ffd7b/docs/getting-started/installation/mac.md)
-   [forem-docs:docs/getting-started/syncing.md](https://github.com/forem/forem-docs/blob/4c5b78ff2d58620735f4fc720bdf4741926ffd7b/docs/getting-started/syncing.md)
-   [forem-docs:docs/troubleshooting.md](https://github.com/forem/forem-docs/blob/4c5b78ff2d58620735f4fc720bdf4741926ffd7b/docs/troubleshooting.md)
-   [forem-docs:docs/backend/data-update-scripts.md](https://github.com/forem/forem-docs/blob/4c5b78ff2d58620735f4fc720bdf4741926ffd7b/docs/backend/data-update-scripts.md)

Callers/references to `scripts/entrypoint.sh`:

-   [forem/docker-compose.yml](https://github.com/forem/forem/blob/3253ba2c7a03594a9064abf2aa4c3fba085099f5/docker-compose.yml#L27)
-   [forem/container-compose.yml](https://github.com/forem/forem/blob/3253ba2c7a03594a9064abf2aa4c3fba085099f5/forem/container-compose.yml#L27)
-   [forem/Containerfile](https://github.com/forem/forem/blob/3253ba2c7a03594a9064abf2aa4c3fba085099f5/Containerfile)

Callers/references to `forem/release-tasks.sh`:

None.

## PlantUML Diagram

### Diagram

![navigation_links-create](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2130/149540199-2bce5012-1fbe-40a7-809b-9791b6b7484a.png)

### Text

Below is a [PlantUML](https://plantuml.com/) textual representation of the relationship graph.

```plantuml
@startuml
  !theme amiga
  
  title "Call and documentation graph for navigation_links:create task."
  footer "See https://github.com/forem/forem/issues/15960"
  
  ' This is the task that we call which is creating the issue.
  
  "navigation_links:create task" as nlc
  agent  note right of nlc
  Note: finds or creates
  side links
  end note
  
  ' This section defines the reference points
  agent "forem:setup task" as fs
  agent "app_initializer:setup task" as ais
  file "bin/setup script" as bs
  file "scripts/entrypoint.sh script" as se
  file "forem/release-tasks.sh script" as frt
  file "gitpod-init.sh script" as gi
  package "forem-docs" as foremDocs {
    artifact "getting-started/start-app.md" as dgssa
    artifact "getting-started/installation/linux.md" as dgsil
    artifact "getting-started/installation/windows.md" as dgsiw
    artifact "getting-started/workflow.md" as dgsw
    artifact "getting-started/installation/mac.md" as dgsim
    artifact "getting-started/syncing.md" as dgss
    artifact "troubleshooting.md" as dt
    artifact "backend/data-update-scripts.md" as dbdus
  }
  file "forem/docker-compose.yml" as fdc
  file "forem/container-compose.yml" as fcc
  file "forem/Containerfile" as fc
  
  ' This section describes the relationships
  fs --> nlc : "calls"
  ais --> fs : "calls"
  bs --> ais : "calls"
  bs --> fs : "calls"
  se --> ais : "calls"
  frt --> ais : "calls"
  gi --> bs : "calls"
  foremDocs -l-> bs : "documents\nusage of"
  fdc --> se : "calls"
  fcc --> se : "calls"
  fc --> se : "calls"
@enduml
```
My instinct is to say that we should have a conceptual separation between an initial setup and a synchronization.  The setup would run the link task.  The synchronization would not.

issue.title: Allow for skipping navigation link creation

labels.name: PR: merged
labels.description: bot applied label for PR's that are merged

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
## What type of PR is this? (check all applicable)

- [ ] Refactor
- [x] Feature
- [x] Bug Fix
- [ ] Optimization
- [ ] Documentation Update

## Description

This commit provides a possible solution for preventing the re-creation
of a navigation link deleted by a Forem creator.

What I need is a discussion around the life-cycle of the application
installation and updates.

In particular, does this provide a robust enough mechanism for resolving
the issue at hand?

_Note: it pains me to ask about a user's role, but this is provided as a
point of discussion and possible implementationi to address the
underlying issue.  But I'm referencing a constant in the Rake task so
hopefully that will help future refactors.  Also, it's one reason I
needed to remove the `private_constant` declaration._

If we accept this code change, a future task is to document the ENV and
behavior.

### Further considerations

- How might we refine this to not be as "role" reliant?
- Could we have a Site::Setting that we enable/disable
  regarding the navigation links?

## Related Tickets & Documents

Closes #15960


## QA Instructions, Screenshots, Recordings

Here's the steps I took.  Note the guard clause means there are several ways to create or skip creating.

- Start from an empty database
- Run setup
- Verify Navigation Link exists
- Delete Navigation Link
- Run setup again
- Verify Navigation Link exists (because we don't have a user)
- Run seeds
- Delete Navigation Link
- Run setup again
- Verify Navigation Link exists (because we don't have a user)

```shell
$ cd ./path/to/forem/repo

$ rails db:drop db:create db:schema:load

$ bin/setup

$ bin/rails runner "puts NavigationLink.where(url: '/readinglist').exists?"
  => true

$ bin/rails runner "NavigationLink.where(url: '/readinglist').delete_all"

$ bin/rails runner "puts NavigationLink.where(url: '/readinglist').exists?"
  => false

$ bin/setup

$ bin/rails runner "puts NavigationLink.where(url: '/readinglist').exists?"
  => true

$ bin/rails db:seed

$ bin/rails runner "NavigationLink.where(url: '/readinglist').delete_all"

$ bin/rails runner "puts NavigationLink.where(url: '/readinglist').exists?"
  => false

$ bin/setup

$ bin/rails runner "puts NavigationLink.where(url: '/readinglist').exists?"c
  => false
```

### UI accessibility concerns?

## Added/updated tests?

- [x] No, and this is why: We don't have tests for these kind of things; they are a bit hard and slow to run.

## [Forem core team only] How will this change be communicated?

- [ ] This PR changes the Forem platform and our documentation needs to be
      updated. I have filled out the
      [Changes Requested](https://github.com/forem/admin-docs/issues/new?assignees=&labels=&template=changes_requested.md)
      issue template so Community Success can help update the Admin Docs
      appropriately.
- [x] I will share this change internally with the appropriate teams

_Note: I have not updated the documentation as this is pending discussion._
